medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with a 1-day duration of abdominal pain, which began upon waking. The pain is located in the right lower quadrant over the area of the pancreatic transplant. It persisted after returning to bed and has not correlated with food consumption. The patient denies any nausea, vomiting, or changes in bowel habits, though she has chronic diarrhea at baseline. A fall from a bike one week prior may be a related factor, though no specific abdominal injury was recalled. Alcohol consumption involved two glasses of wine one week ago.
medical_history.past_medical_history: DM type 1 with retinopathy, nephropathy and neuropathy; gastroparesis; esophageal dysmotility; pancreatic insufficiency; chronic diarrhea; esophageal ulcer; chronic edema following renal and pancreatic transplants; history of cholecystectomy; mild neuropathy; moderate retinopathy post-multiple laser treatments; history of hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis; lactose intolerance; frequent urinary tract infections post-transplant; history of left subclavian stent due to chronically swollen left arm; right foot osteomyelitis; osteoporosis; bilateral hammer toes; hypothyroidism; lymphedema in left arm of unknown etiology.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from alcoholism; mother has no medical problems specified; sister has anal cancer.
